definition: warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]

sentences.english: Place the chopped chocolate into a heatproof bowl.

sentences.english: The latter is of white colony, heat resistance and smooth chlamydospores .

sentences.english: High disease resistance to black rot. Best culture temperature during daytime 25-33℃.

sentences.english: Aluminized coating has fine corrosion-resistant and heat-resistant abiliities.

sentences.english: The modeling and identification of anisotropic damping property of Ni based single crystal alloys are presented.
sentences.chinese: 研究耐高溫鎳基合金各向異性阻尼特性的建模與識別。

sentences.english: Oven's doors must be hermetic to prevent heat loss and refractory.

sentences.english: This paper studies the multilayer coatings system resistant to high temperature.

sentences.english: Conclusion The method may be used to prepare soluble and high-temperature poly(arylene ether)s.

sentences.english: Lotus prefers full sunlight and relatively water, and is tolerant of heat.
sentences.chinese: 蓮花喜強光及靜水，且耐高溫。

sentences.english: The tiles are backed by a high-temperature-resistant material on the nose and leading edges of the wings.

sentences.english: A formula of heat-resistance EPDM for food contact application was studied.

sentences.english: Therefore, developing UV curing high-temperature resistant coating has practical significance.

sentences.english: The product has good heat durability that withstands lead-free compatible reflow soldering conditions.

sentences.english: Protective tube can be made of material can work under high temperature.
